Dear Ms. McMahon:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
03/04/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Tyler Armstrong, Licensing Consultant

(1) Within 7 calendar days of admission, a plan shall be

all of the following:

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility is advised to create a template that adheres to the specific
requirements in CCI Rule 400.4113 (1) (g) to ensure that a proper review of
employee criminal convictions occurs when necessary.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
3

• The facility is advised to ensure that all staff have access to and are aware
of applicable licensing rules for their responsibilities.
• Consultation was provided on ensuring that the facility is aware of what
youth are placed and what staff are assigned with the organization's
various programs and licenses.
• Consultation was provided regarding the distribution and organization of
specific forms within youth case files to ensure consistency and rule
compliance.
• The facility was provided up-to-date information on requirements within
employee records regarding tuberculosis testing.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no instances of maltreatment in care during this reporting period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
One corrective action plan was submitted and approved during the period under
review. This was a result of the 2023 Renewal inspection, and the CAP was
approved as of 12/20/2023. The corrective action plan contained responses to
three rule violations all regarding discharge planning. The action items for this CAP
were effective as there were no repeat findings during this inspection.
Financial Overview
The organization’s most recent financial audit for 2023 and a current budget was
reviewed, and no concerns were noted about the organization.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The annual assessment completed by the Chief Administrator dated 02/24/2025
was provided and reviewed. The previous year's Corrective Action Plan was
analyzed as well as an increase in unplanned discharges due to youth going AWOL
from the voluntary program. In addition, difficulties in hiring for the Direct Care
Supervisor position was discussed.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
03/04/2025. Staff interviewed reported positive recent experiences working within
the program, including new efforts to redesign the behavior management
programming including adequate staff feedback. They felt adequately trained and
supported by management.
One youth was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility
on 03/04/2025. They reported a positive experience within the program, having
4

good communication with their family while in the program and receiving support for
what possible placements could come next. They felt safe and properly cared for
at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the facility was completed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit to the facility on 03/04/2025. The facility was in clean and organized condition
at the time of this face-to-face visit. No safety concerns were noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
